title: A Semantic Graph-based Approach for Radicalisation Detection on Social Media

author: Hassan Saif, Knowledge Media Institute (KMI), Open University (OU)

segmentation: Right, so to those who don't know me, my name is Hasan Sahih Pharma research associate at the Open University.
In came I and today I'm going to present our work on a semantic graph based approach for radicalization detection on social media.
So.

Online radicalization is the process by which individuals are introduced to mainstream beliefs and views that can move them from their sorry extreme believes that move them from their mainstream beliefs into more extreme views, mainly due to the use of online media.
Now in our work here.
Here we are going to target the problem for radicalization by focusing on this one that is related to ISIS.

Actually, for the last few years, specially in France, Germany, Belgium and more recently in Manchester in United Kingdom.

Approach is machine learning approach.

This approach basically uses supervised machine learning classifier in general such as SVM, naive Bayes etc and trained trained from features extracted from the users timelines who are already annotated with their stance, whether they are pro, ISIS or anti ISIS.
After that, the trained classifier is applied to timelines of other users in order to predict or to detect their radicalization stance.
Now these approaches have shown, like relatively good performance.
However, the problem is they.

Mainly rely on lexical representation of features extracted from the timelines of the users, and this can be problematic sometimes because the radicalization stance of a given user might be represented within the semantic relations between words in his timeline.

For example, the semantic relation symmetric relation between ISIS and Syria could be represented by the military intervention against ISIS, which is located in Syria as well as ISIS is located in Syria.

Graph mining and finally classifier training.
